data.title: Helgoland Marathon — Germany
data.meta_description: The Helgoland Marathon, which is held yearly in May on the tiny North Sea island of Helgoland (English: Heligoland), Germany, is a unique running event
data.text:
Saturday 4 May 2024

Held yearly in May on Helgoland (English: Heligoland), a tiny North Sea island located about fifty kilometres off the German coast, the Helgoland Marathon stands out as a unique running event.

Two race options are available for participants:

5.25km Mini-Marathon (one lap)

42.195km Marathon (195m + eight laps)

Starting and finishing at the Südstrand beach, the route is very challenging as it takes the runners on paved paths through the Unterland (the low-lying parts of Helgoland) as well as around the Oberland plateau.

The difference between the lowest and the highest point on the course is approximately fifty metres.

The time limit to complete the course is six hours.
